page.title: 11Social Concern in S.Bradford
page.content: Ever since Bradford began to grow as a textile town in the early 19th century it has provided work for many different{immigrant groups.}The first immigrants were the{Germans}who moved to Bradford from Leeds.They were business men and began trading in textiles.The potato famines in Ireland resulted in an{Irish}influx to work in the mills.These groups were followed by the{Poles,Latvians,Lithuanians, {Estonians and Ukrainians}who moved to Bradford at the begining and end of the 2nd World War.Since then the{West {Indians}and{Asians}have moved into Bradford.The Asians came to work in the mills,particularly on the night shifts.Bradford has accepted all these peoples and has had very few racial problems.Most of these people try to keep their own identities and have their own clubs and organizations.
